column3: Concept ACK: good idea!\n\nCould perhaps check for `yq` and skip the Gitian checking if it is not installed (with a warning message) in order to not break current setups?
@dongcarl \nThank you for your review. All your comments have been addressed.
> For all the places where you had to split `export DIR=$(pwd)`, just use `export DIR="$PWD"`, which doesn't require the splitting\n\nDone.

Is this really necessary? Couldn't use some YAML processor like `yq`?
There is no straightforward [way](https://mikefarah.github.io/yq/) to install `yq` on Travis, unfortunately.\n\nOr did you mean [that `yq`](https://yq.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)?

> Couldn't use some YAML processor like `yq`?

Done.
TIL, thank you ;)
```suggestion\n  DISTNAME=${SOURCEDIST/%.tar.gz}\n```
```suggestion\n    OUTFILE="${INFILE/%-unsigned}"\n```
Same here.
Same here.
Done.
Done.
Done.
Done.

```suggestion
    SCRIPT=$'#!/usr/bin/env bash
'$(yq -r .script "$descriptor")
```

It just mimics the way [gitian-builder/bin/gbuild](https://github.com/devrandom/gitian-builder/blob/cd8aa53c4e8870fa6be614a653024bae094c2f22/bin/gbuild#L128) makes shell script:
```
  File.open("var/build-script", "w") do |script|
    script.puts "#!/bin/bash"
```
Ah! Makes sense to do it this way, could you add a comment?
Sure!
Done.
~~Did you mean `${PWD}`?~~ never mind, different kind of brackets

Let's be consistent and just use `$PWD` everywhere. 
```suggestion
  BASEPREFIX="${PWD}/depends"
```

> Let's be consistent and just use `$PWD` everywhere.

Agree.

Ref:
```bash
$ echo $0
bash
$ type pwd
pwd is a shell builtin
$ pwd --help
pwd: pwd [-LP]
    Print the name of the current working directory.
    
    Options:
      -L	print the value of $PWD if it names the current working
    		directory
      -P	print the physical directory, without any symbolic l
Done.
